infoItems.title: Quantitative Finance
infoItems.tags: reinforcement learning, monte carlo, black-scholes, heston models
infoItems.paragraph: I enjoy solving complex problems, fuelled by passion in the fields of mathematics, statistics, and machine learning. My current readings are on Monte Carlo methods in computational finance, alongside other stochastic forms of computation. I am also working on projects combining deep reinforcement learning for trading. Also interested in the space of fusing the gap between large language models and financial markets, allowing for augmented ways to qualitatively process language data as signals for trading.

infoItems.title: Machine Learning
infoItems.tags: data science and statistics stuff from countless competitions
infoItems.paragraph: I specialise in using (lots of) data to derive insights and fix things, sparked by lot of experiences from data science hackathons, personal readings, projects, and from modules taught at Imperial. I also have experience in building LLM tools and appreciate their vast potential for future real-world applications.

infoItems.title: Software Engineering
infoItems.tags: javascript web fun, functional programming, low-level languages
infoItems.paragraph: As a part of my degree I have refined many practices underpinning this. I possess practical experience in various frontend/backend tools, and other coding frameworks for engineering and data science. Also learning more on functional programming, and low-level languages.
